Pre-Game Insights: Dejounte Murray is excited to see Zion Williamson return to the team, and believes that Williamson's presence will open up opportunities for himself and other teammates.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Minnesota Timberwolves have enjoyed lineup continuity this season, with four starters appearing in all 35 games.
Others: The New Orleans Pelicans will be without Trey Murphy due to a left ankle sprain, and Brandon Ingram is also questionable for the game.
New Orleans Pelicans: The Pelicans have now relied on the same starting lineup for 12 straight games.
Minnesota Timberwolves: The Timberwolves have won 1 game in a row and are 11-12 in clutch games this season.
Anthony Edwards: Edwards scored a career-high 53 points in a Saturday loss at Detroit, and followed that up with 37 points in a win over the Clippers.
Zion Williamson: Williamson will play his first game since Nov. 6, and is expected to help the team's offense.
Dejounte Murray: Murray has been a key contributor to the team despite not scoring at a high level, and is happy to see Williamson return to the team.
